posts.post_content: First off, this is an activated ability not a triggered one. And both activated AND triggered abilities do use the stack. You CAN unmake this card and it will be removed from the game normally, you could respond to the player's paying the colorless and sac-ing a critter with unmake, and either unmake the creature or force the player to try to use the ability again.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
B/W is the color of Orshov, the color of Haunt. i.e., you can sacrifice a creature you control with something haunting it to maximize the control instead of waiting for opponent to kill it.
  
   
M10 rules kinda damaged the power of this card but it's still really powerful.

posts.post_content:
Hmmm.... A little bit of a mess here.  
  
Its almost very very cool, but not quite there. If only it cost manna instead of creatures...  
  
At any rate, its not a bad card... Although its about as color heavy as they come, more or less, this creature will be in an exclusively black and white deck, always. Although it is only a converted manna cost of 4 and for a 4/4 creature.  
  
The problem is that in order to use this creature effectively it must be in a black white deck with lost of garbage creatures to throw away. Although, he becomes a nearly invulnerable under the correct cir\*\*\*stances.  
  
Although its possibly the coolest of the guild leaders (except perhaps Niv Mizzet) It can only really be used effectively in a black/white deck with either token generation or lots of creatures that stop being useful very quickly. The problem becomes that the creature is useless except in just this sort of deck.  
  
Upsides: these guys can dominate a field as 4/4 creatures. Also, as long as you have a Devout... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Hmmm.... A little bit of a mess here.

Its almost very very cool, but not quite there. If only it cost manna instead of creatures...

At any rate, its not a bad card... Although its about as color heavy as they come, more or less, this creature will be in an exclusively black and white deck, always. Although it is only a converted manna cost of 4 and for a 4/4 creature.

The problem is that in order to use this creature effectively it must be in a black white deck with lost of garbage creatures to throw away. Although, he becomes a nearly invulnerable under the correct cir***stances.

Although its possibly the coolest of the guild leaders (except perhaps Niv Mizzet) It can only really be used effectively in a black/white deck with either token generation or lots of creatures that stop being useful very quickly. The problem becomes that the creature is useless except in just this sort of deck.

Upsides: these guys can dominate a field as 4/4 creatures. Also, as long as you have a Devout... (see all)
